sections.title: Who are we?
sections.subtitle: There are over 4,000 of us on the platform, but we can help you find the right person. Here are our most recently active members.

text.content:
A world in which every human can live up to her full potential as a creative, responsible being. That is our vision. Our community culture is such that we collaboratively structure and share what we learn with anyone who needs it, whenever the need arises.

Right now the priority is mobilisation around Covid19 crisis response.

Many institutions, civil society organisations, companies and informal networks need to quickly set up good remote work practices. But, remote collaboration can be hard. We have made all the mistakes and found good solutions so others don’t have to.

sections.title: Help us reach our fundraising goal of €10,000

text.content:
We're developing an online course with the aim to cover the essentials of remote work and collaboration.

Due to the current crisis, we are getting many requests to help people set up or improve their remote collaboration practises. So we are doing a sprint to quickly set up and share an Open Online Course on distributed collaboration.

sections.title: Our Courses
sections.subtitle: Since 2018 we've been producing online courses on fields and practices we believe to relevant to the 21st century workplace. You can find more at Edgeryders Academy.

sections.title: The Mission
sections.subtitle: A dense network of co-created solutions to the big issues
sections.description: Our theory of change is building dense networks around people trying to tackle messy socialecological, economic and political challenges. Having a dense network around you is one of the hallmarks of social capital, and gives you access to expertise, resources, skill sharing and financing. In a dense network, there are many ways for you to get from one point to another. A key challenge here is for people with aligned interests to find each other, and as a community we’re out to solve just that.

sections.title: Why share your story?
sections.subtitle: Edgeryders is not built on likes or hashtags. It is built on meaningful human connections and inspiration, which are the results of sharing and making sense of experiences together.
sections.description:
Tell us a bit about yourself and where you are right now.

Your story may help someone else out. Or, perhaps, by talking about what you're dealing with, you'll find an opportunity to solve a problem you've been wrestling with.
